text: that would be so useful if you could actually see nesting instead of trying to spot the brackets in a huge string

Also in links and url fields:
You should be able able to use anchors and queries without needing to write the current url in the external url field which could potentially change and break things if the page url changes and you forget to update the links

:bulb: Provide in the DM a "download" button when right clicking on a module, template etc.
Right now, I just want to download a cloned default @HubSpot module to check the meta.json (which is not possible to see in the DM). So I have to clone the module, go to CLI and fetch it, not a lot but you know :yum:
Or just an Advanced checkbox in the settings that lets you see and edit all the meta and fields json files in the DM
Or there could be a view that shows the meta.json  that can be selected like "show dependencies"
<@UDJV5B73R> so kind of like in an OS where you say "show hidden files" ?
yeah that would also be a great idea!
I don’t know if you could add this to cta’s too so you can track clicks of links to other places on the same page, or create a cta to open a modal

Hey all, love this conversation and the suggestions.

Question for ya about the implementation - which would you rather:
1. modules had a download button which resulted in a zip file being generated, then when created you are prompted and can download the file, and then extract.
2. We provide some form of shortcut to doing a fetch via the CLI. A potential option being that it generates the fetch command with the path to the module for you. (that way there’s no dealing with zip files which could clutter your project folder and require waiting for zipping/unzipping)
3. We provide a copy feature similar to how we do with the fields.json for meta.json data.
download and fetch sounds best to me
